context.p: As a practical example, the following procedure can be used to change the background color of the footer bar in the WebHelp output of the Oxygen XML Editor User Guide.

step.cmd: Use the browser's CSS inspector to identify the current CSS code that styles the footer bar. In this particular case, the pertinent code that would be identified is:

If you want to test the color you want to apply as the background of this particular element, use the browser's CSS inspector to change the value of the background-color attribute. After you find a suitable color, copy that new code.
Create a custom CSS file and paste or enter the copied code. For example:
Save the custom CSS file at a location of your convenience.

result.p: You should have a new CSS file, wh_footer.css on your disk.

postreq.p: The customization CSS file can be referenced from the WebHelp Responsive transformation either from a or using the args.css parameter.
